The Greeks called this amber \"elektron,\" which later gave us the word \"electricity.\" This same force that pulled feathers to rubbed amber was dancing through the clouds above Tesla's head, connecting earth and sky in brilliant arcs.","title":"The Curious Spark","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:07:26.364693"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%94%B5%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E6%9D%A5%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421150725_72f6fffb.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%94%B5%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E6%9D%A5%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421150623_f0933f97.mp3","textContent":"Inside a modern power plant, massive turbines spun rapidly. Tesla examined the giant machines with a knowing smile. Electricity comes from movement—when magnets pass near coils of wire, they push invisible electrons into motion, creating electric current. This discovery changed human history! Water falling over dams, steam from heated water, or even wind can turn these turbines. The faster they spin, the more electrons flow, generating more electricity to power our homes and schools.","title":"Power from Motion","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:07:26.364693"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%94%B5%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E6%9D%A5%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421150725_8d652430.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%94%B5%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E6%9D%A5%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421150629_903f9089.mp3","textContent":"Morning sunlight streamed onto a field of solar panels. Tesla adjusted his sunglasses while observing how these dark, shimmering rectangles captured the sun's energy. Sunlight contains tiny packets of energy called photons. When these photons strike special materials in solar panels, they knock electrons loose, creating electricity directly from sunshine! No smoke, no noise—just silent conversion of light into power. The same sun that grows plants and warms our skin also provides clean electricity for our modern world.","title":"Sun's Electric Gift","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:07:26.364693"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%94%B5%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E6%9D%A5%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421150725_899dfa7a.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%94%B5%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E6%9D%A5%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421150635_a77ee93b.mp3","textContent":"Rows of batteries lined the laboratory shelf as Tesla carefully connected them to a small light bulb. Inside each battery, chemical reactions were hard at work. When certain materials like zinc and carbon interact with chemicals, they trade electrons, creating an electric current. This chemical electricity powered early flashlights, toys, and portable radios before homes had electrical outlets. Tesla demonstrated how connecting batteries in a circuit allows electrons to flow in one continuous path, lighting up the bulb with stored chemical energy.","title":"Chemical Reactions","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:07:26.364693"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%94%B5%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E6%9D%A5%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421150726_3eb02264.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%94%B5%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E6%9D%A5%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421150641_97685143.mp3","textContent":"High above city streets, power lines stretched between tall towers. Tesla traced their path with his finger, explaining the journey electricity takes. From power plants, electricity travels through these wires at nearly the speed of light! Transformers change the voltage for safe delivery to neighborhoods. The electrical grid forms an enormous network, like a giant circulatory system carrying energy instead of blood. This invisible river of electrons flows constantly, ready to power anything we plug into a wall socket.","title":"Invisible Network","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:07:26.364693"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%94%B5%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E6%9D%A5%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421150726_1970ece0.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%94%B5%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E6%9D%A5%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421150647_e31c29d6.mp3","textContent":"Waves crashed against an offshore platform where devices captured their energy. Tesla sketched designs for new electricity sources in his notebook. Beyond traditional methods, electricity can come from ocean waves, underground heat, and even tiny vibrations. Scientists are developing materials that generate electricity when squeezed or bent. In the future, our shoes might charge our phones as we walk! Electricity surrounds us in countless forms—we just need clever ways to capture it, continuing the brilliant journey that began with amber and fur.","title":"Future Power","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:07:26.364693"}],"imageValid":true}

title: The Invisible Internet Highway
topic_question: 你知道 Wifi 是怎么工作的吗？
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962947531885441","knowledgeAreaId":"Physics & Science","characterId":"7","chatGroupCode":"e0256327-0533-4e4d-97bb-106a9b68a18d","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421151143_6a6c49ab.png","bookTitle":"The Invisible Internet Highway","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421151143_6a6c49ab.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421151029_cf7eb7a0.mp3","textContent":"Radio waves danced through the air, completely invisible to human eyes. These special waves carried information across great distances without any wires. In his laboratory, Tesla adjusted a small device that could detect these invisible messengers. \"Just like ocean waves carry boats, radio waves carry information,\" Tesla explained to himself. He sketched a diagram showing how these waves spread out in all directions from a source, just like ripples in a pond when a stone is dropped.","title":"Invisible Radio Waves","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:11:45.199349"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421151144_15d05509.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421151035_13dc774f.mp3","textContent":"Inside a modern home stood a small box with blinking lights. This unassuming device was actually a powerful transmitter. The internal circuits transformed digital information into radio waves. Tesla carefully opened a router to examine its components. \"This clever device converts our internet data into radio waves at a specific frequency—2.4 or 5 gigahertz,\" Tesla noted. He observed how the router's tiny antennas sent these waves outward in all directions, filling the house with an invisible network.","title":"The Wi-Fi Router's Secret","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:11:45.199349"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421151144_3720e883.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421151040_b678078b.mp3","textContent":"Information traveled through the air as patterns of ones and zeros. Each photo, video, or website was broken down into this binary code. Tesla used his computer to download a picture, watching as the progress bar filled. \"The router is packaging this image into data packets and sending them through the air right now,\" Tesla realized. He imagined these packets as tiny digital envelopes, each containing a small piece of the complete picture, all flying through the room at nearly the speed of light.","title":"Digital Messages in the Air","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:11:45.199349"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421151144_c927b264.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421151046_12aa7061.mp3","textContent":"Smartphones, tablets, and laptops contained special receivers that could detect and interpret Wi-Fi signals. These receivers listened for the specific radio frequencies used by Wi-Fi. Tesla held up his tablet, watching as the Wi-Fi signal strength indicator showed four bars. \"This device is constantly listening for those radio waves and converting them back into digital information,\" he observed. The tablet's tiny antenna captured the waves, while its processor reassembled the data packets into usable information.","title":"Receiving the Signal","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:11:45.199349"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421151144_d9532814.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421151051_6e48743c.mp3","textContent":"Radio waves could pass through many objects, but not all. Thick concrete walls, metal objects, and water could weaken or block the signal. Tesla walked around a house with a signal strength meter, noting how the Wi-Fi weakened in certain areas. \"The waves are like light—they can go through some things but get blocked by others,\" Tesla thought. He placed the router higher up and away from metal objects, watching as the signal strength improved throughout the house.","title":"Overcoming Obstacles","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:11:45.199349"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421151145_e90e4a51.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421151057_f11823d0.mp3","textContent":"Wi-Fi networks created invisible bridges connecting billions of devices worldwide. This wireless technology had transformed how people lived, worked, and communicated. Tesla sat in a park, watching people using their devices. \"From Marconi's first radio transmissions to today's high-speed Wi-Fi, we've harnessed invisible waves to connect our world,\" Tesla reflected. He imagined the countless invisible conversations happening through the air around him, connecting people across neighborhoods, cities, and continents.","title":"A World Connected","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T15:11:45.199349"}],"imageValid":true}

title: 看不见的网
topic_question: 你知道 Wifi 是怎么工作的吗？
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962947531485440","knowledgeAreaId":"Physics & Science","characterId":"7","chatGroupCode":"0c9675d4-ed85-4a04-b626-bdb3437114cd","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421162137_8e3530a9.png","bookTitle":"看不见的网","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421162137_8e3530a9.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421162028_0d4085e6.mp3","textContent":"无线电波在空气中无声地穿行，就像看不见的魔法。Leo坐在客厅地板上，好奇地盯着家里的WiFi路由器，那个小盒子上闪烁的灯光似乎在传递某种信息。他伸出手指轻轻触碰路由器，想象着从中发射出的看不见的信号如何让他的平板电脑能够连接到互联网。","title":"神秘的无线电波","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:21:38.420597"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421162137_f82e8cc8.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421162034_08bf16be.mp3","textContent":"电子设备内部隐藏着复杂的微型世界。Leo拿起放大镜，假装能看到路由器内部的电路板和天线。路由器就像一个小型广播站，不断地发送和接收数据。当Leo按下平板电脑上的视频播放按钮时，路由器立刻将这个请求转化为电子信号，通过特殊的天线以无线电波的形式向四周扩散。","title":"路由器的秘密","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:21:38.420597"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421162137_673a0b6d.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421162039_7062e7c1.mp3","textContent":"无线电波以光速穿越空间，穿过墙壁和物体。Leo在房间里四处走动，手持平板电脑测试信号强度。他发现离路由器越远，信号越弱，因为无线电波会随着距离的增加而减弱。当他躲进衣柜时，信号变得更弱了，因为无线电波必须穿过更多的障碍物才能到达他的设备。","title":"波浪的旅程","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:21:38.420597"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421162137_e0eb5406.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421162045_9e23f941.mp3","textContent":"无线电波有不同的频率，就像音乐中的不同音符。Leo在纸上画出波浪线，表示不同频率的无线电波。WiFi主要使用2.4GHz和5GHz两种频率。他用手指沿着波浪线移动，理解到高频波能传输更多数据但穿透能力较弱，而低频波则相反，能传得更远但速度较慢。","title":"频率的世界","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:21:38.420597"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421162138_261f833b.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421162051_31864abd.mp3","textContent":"数据在无线电波中以二进制代码传输，像是一种特殊的摩尔斯电码。Leo拿起一串圣诞灯，开关闪烁来模拟二进制的\"0\"和\"1\"。当他的平板电脑接收到这些信号时，内部的接收器会捕捉这些无线电波，然后解码成有意义的信息——文字、图片、声音或视频，最终显示在屏幕上。","title":"数据的舞蹈","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:21:38.420597"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421162138_e730fb9e.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93+Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C%E7%9A%84%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421162056_193b8678.mp3","textContent":"全球数十亿设备通过相同的原理相互连接。Leo站在窗前，望着远处的建筑物，想象着无数看不见的WiFi信号在城市上空交织成网。他明白了自己的平板电脑、家里的智能电视、甚至学校的电脑都是通过这种无形的电波连接在一起，共同构成了一个庞大的信息网络，让人们能够即时分享知识和交流。","title":"连接的奇迹","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:21:38.420597"}],"imageValid":true}
ser_send: {"age":9,"characterId":"7","chatGroupCode":"0c9675d4-ed85-4a04-b626-bdb3437114cd","knowledgeAreaId":"Physics & Science","language":"cn","pickedRole":"leo","topicQuestion":"你知道 Wifi 是怎么工作的吗？","userId":"1897962947531485440"}

title: 地球的舞步
topic_question: 为什么地球不会掉下去？
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962947531485440","knowledgeAreaId":"Astronomy","characterId":"6","chatGroupCode":"306aa327-b7cc-4fb3-afe0-0f2ae2696195","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421162748_0f6acedf.png","bookTitle":"地球的舞步","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421162748_0f6acedf.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421162635_842c6a09.mp3","textContent":"夜空中繁星点点，像无数闪烁的宝石。Leo躺在草地上，仰望着浩瀚的星空，心中充满疑惑。他伸出小手，仿佛要抓住那些星星，突然想到一个问题：地球是悬浮在太空中的，为什么它不会像苹果一样掉下去呢？这个想法让Leo既好奇又兴奋，他决定寻找答案。","title":"仰望星空","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:27:49.698905"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421162748_47a7c486.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421162640_01bc6866.mp3","textContent":"阳光透过窗户洒进房间。Leo拿起一个小球，松开手指，球立刻落到地上。他又试了几次，每次结果都一样。Leo恍然大悟，这是地球的引力在起作用！地球就像一个巨大的磁铁，吸引着所有物体向它靠近。但这仍然解释不了为什么地球本身不会下落，Leo继续探索。","title":"引力实验","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:27:49.698905"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421162748_845c13f3.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421162646_48524434.mp3","textContent":"宇宙的奥秘在科学馆中展现。Leo站在一个巨大的太阳系模型前，看着各个行星围绕太阳旋转。他注意到地球和其他行星都在轨道上运行，没有支撑却不会掉下去。原来，地球一直在\"掉\"，但同时也在向前运动，这两种力量的平衡让地球保持在轨道上，就像抛出的石头在空中划出弧线。","title":"太空模型","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:27:49.698905"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421162749_24ba85b8.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421162652_844535c9.mp3","textContent":"图书馆里安静祥和。Leo翻开一本关于牛顿的科学书，了解到万有引力定律。宇宙中所有物体都相互吸引，地球吸引我们，同时太阳也吸引着地球。这种引力的大小取决于物体的质量和距离。太阳巨大的质量产生强大引力，将地球和其他行星保持在各自的轨道上。","title":"万有引力","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:27:49.698905"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421162749_dba4fc87.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421162657_4de3f31c.mp3","textContent":"操场上，Leo拿着一根绳子，绳子另一端系着一个小球。他让小球旋转起来，形成一个圆。只要保持适当的速度，小球就不会掉下来也不会飞走。地球绕太阳运行也是这样，它的速度恰好使它既不会撞向太阳，也不会飞离太阳系，而是在一个稳定的椭圆轨道上运行。","title":"轨道运动","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:27:49.698905"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421162749_69706da3.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%83%E4%B8%8D%E4%BC%9A%E6%8E%89%E4%B8%8B%E5%8E%BB%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421162702_be1b5821.mp3","textContent":"夕阳西下，天空变成了美丽的橙红色。Leo坐在窗前，思考着今天学到的知识。他明白了地球不会\"掉下去\"，因为宇宙中没有真正的\"上下\"。地球在太空中保持平衡，是因为引力和运动的完美结合。这种宇宙的和谐让Leo感到无比惊奇，他对探索更多科学奥秘充满了期待。","title":"宇宙平衡","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:27:49.698905"}],"imageValid":true}
ser_send: {"age":9,"characterId":"6","chatGroupCode":"306aa327-b7cc-4fb3-afe0-0f2ae2696195","knowledgeAreaId":"Astronomy","language":"cn","pickedRole":"leo","topicQuestion":"为什么地球不会掉下去？","userId":"1897962947531485440"}

title: 看不见的WiFi侠
topic_question: Wifi 是怎么跑的？
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962947531485440","knowledgeAreaId":"Physics & Science","characterId":"7","chatGroupCode":"5e3671f4-3be3-48c9-b8d8-f9598e0fc81d","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421163028_71ce3fff.png","bookTitle":"看不见的WiFi侠","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421163028_71ce3fff.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421162920_71a749dc.mp3","textContent":"电波在空气中无声地穿行，就像看不见的信使。Leo坐在客厅里，好奇地盯着家里的WiFi路由器，那个小盒子上闪烁的灯光似乎在诉说着什么。他拿起平板电脑，轻触屏幕，视频立刻开始播放，这让他感到神奇——信息是如何无线传递的呢？","title":"无形电波","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:30:29.748882"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421163028_83e031b5.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421162925_82f54baa.mp3","textContent":"无线电波是一种看不见的能量形式。Leo拿出一张纸，画下路由器如何工作：当我们上网时，路由器会把数字信息转换成无线电波发射出去。他用手指在空中画了几道波浪线，想象着这些波浪从路由器向四面八方扩散，就像往平静的水面扔下一颗石子，涟漪向外扩散。","title":"电波发射","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:30:29.748882"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421163028_0db8a16c.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421162931_dc44e349.mp3","textContent":"无线电波以光速传播，每秒行进30万公里。Leo在房间里走来走去，手持平板电脑测试信号强度。他发现靠近路由器时，信号格数满格；走到厨房，信号减弱了一些；当他躲进衣柜里，信号几乎消失。这让他明白了无线电波会被墙壁、家具等物体阻挡或减弱。","title":"信号传递","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:30:29.748882"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421163029_0ee82aa5.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421162937_31fe5441.mp3","textContent":"WiFi使用的频率主要是2.4GHz和5GHz。Leo在科学书上看到，这些数字表示电波每秒振动的次数。他拿起两根不同长度的绳子，用力甩动，发现短绳摇得更快（频率高），而长绳摇得较慢（频率低）。这帮助他理解了不同频率的电波如何携带不同的信息量。","title":"频率世界","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:30:29.748882"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421163029_f95cca52.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421162942_8fbe839f.mp3","textContent":"电子设备内部有专门的接收器能捕捉这些无线电波。Leo小心地打开一个旧手机模型，指着里面的天线部分。他明白了手机、平板和电脑都有类似的接收装置，能够捕捉空气中的WiFi信号，就像耳朵能捕捉声波一样，然后将这些电波转换回数字信息，显示在屏幕上。","title":"设备接收","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:30:29.748882"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421163029_ceba1ffa.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Wifi+%E6%98%AF%E6%80%8E%E4%B9%88%E8%B7%91%E7%9A%84%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421162948_bb2d5f0f.mp3","textContent":"互联网数据以二进制代码传输，由0和1组成。Leo在地板上排列了一排多米诺骨牌，有的竖着（代表1），有的横着（代表0）。他轻推第一块，看着它们依次倒下，明白了数据传输的原理。当他用平板观看视频时，无数的0和1正通过WiFi电波，在设备间无声地舞动，构成了他所看到的画面和声音。","title":"数据舞蹈","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T16:30:29.748882"}],"imageValid":true}
ser_send: {"age":9,"characterId":"7","chatGroupCode":"5e3671f4-3be3-48c9-b8d8-f9598e0fc81d","knowledgeAreaId":"Physics & Science","language":"cn","pickedRole":"leo","topicQuestion":"Wifi 是怎么跑的？","userId":"1897962947531485440"}

title: 飞行种子历险记
topic_question: 1: 为什么有些植物的种子会随风移动？
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962948542976000","knowledgeAreaId":"Biology & Nature","characterId":"5","chatGroupCode":"b12128ef-f062-4c43-803c-fcd9403591b4","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421170654_cc05e571.png","bookTitle":"飞行种子历险记","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421170654_cc05e571.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421170546_1c2682b2.mp3","textContent":"春天的花园里，花朵绽放得五彩缤纷。Darwin 蹲下来，仔细观察一朵蒲公英。他轻轻一吹，蒲公英的种子像小伞兵一样，飘啊飘，飞向远方。\"哇！种子在飞舞！\"Darwin 睁大眼睛，惊奇地看着这神奇的一幕。🌼","title":"种子的翅膀","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:06:55.186792"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421170654_4c81042f.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421170551_0054975a.mp3","textContent":"微风轻轻吹过草地。种子们开始了冒险！Darwin 伸出手掌，接住一颗飘落的种子。他发现这颗种子长着毛茸茸的\"小伞\"。\"原来是这个小伞帮种子飞行啊！\"Darwin 笑着说。风一吹，种子就能飞得老高老远，像坐飞机旅行一样。🌬️","title":"风中旅行","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:06:55.186792"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421170654_19d35520.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421170557_7bd92d71.mp3","textContent":"森林里，Darwin 发现了枫树的种子。这些种子长得像小直升机，有两片翅膀。\"咦？这些种子为什么长翅膀？\"Darwin 捡起一片，轻轻一抛。种子旋转着，慢慢飘落。\"哇！它们在跳舞！\"Darwin 开心地跟着转圈圈，模仿种子的动作。🍁","title":"森林探险","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:06:55.186792"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421170654_05c703a4.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421170602_33022e65.mp3","textContent":"阳光明媚的海滩上，Darwin 发现了椰子。\"这么大的种子怎么传播呢？\"他好奇地问。浪花哗啦哗啦拍打岸边，一颗椰子随波浮动。Darwin 明白了！有些种子不靠风，而是靠水流传播，可以漂洋过海，到达新的岛屿，开始新生活。🥥","title":"海边发现","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:06:55.186792"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421170654_918358ee.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421170608_11dd8a90.mp3","textContent":"草丛中，Darwin 看见一颗刺球形的种子粘在小狗毛上。\"这些种子真聪明！\"Darwin 轻轻取下种子，发现上面有小钩子。原来有些种子会粘在动物身上，搭便车去远方。Darwin 想象种子们坐在小鸟背上，或者藏在松鼠的毛里，到处旅行。🐾","title":"动物朋友","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:06:55.186792"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421170655_b9301f11.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_1%3A+%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E6%A4%8D%E7%89%A9%E7%9A%84%E7%A7%8D%E5%AD%90%E4%BC%9A%E9%9A%8F%E9%A3%8E%E7%A7%BB%E5%8A%A8%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421170615_9eaa8724.mp3","textContent":"回到家，Darwin 在花盆里种下刚才收集的种子。\"种子旅行是为了找新家！\"他给种子浇水，想象它们在土里醒来。种子传播到新地方，才能长成新植物，不会和妈妈植物挤在一起抢阳光和水分。Darwin 期待着，种子们很快就会长成美丽的小花和大树！🌱","title":"新生命","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:06:55.186792"}],"imageValid":true}

title: Pixels, Data, and Video Magic
topic_question: 你知道为什么电脑能播视频吗？
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962947531885441","knowledgeAreaId":"Physics & Science","characterId":"7","chatGroupCode":"ac9b15f1-dfc1-4907-bb7d-dc9cb73d81af","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421171022_7c257aa7.png","bookTitle":"Pixels, Data, and Video Magic","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421171022_7c257aa7.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421170911_3fefa127.mp3","textContent":"Colorful squares danced across the computer screen, forming a beautiful scene of a forest. These tiny squares, called pixels, are the building blocks of everything we see on screens. Tesla pointed at the monitor with excitement. Each pixel can display different colors by combining red, green, and blue light in various amounts. When millions of these pixels change colors rapidly, they create the illusion of movement – the foundation of all videos we watch.","title":"The Digital World of Pixels","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:10:23.735001"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421171022_ac91ab97.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421170918_0b4e19fe.mp3","textContent":"A video camera captured a bird in flight, transforming real-world light into electrical signals. Inside the camera's sensor, millions of tiny light detectors work together, similar to our eyes. Tesla examined the camera's inner workings with curiosity. These electrical signals get converted into binary code – just zeros and ones – that computers understand. This process is called digitization, where the continuous world becomes a series of numbers that represent colors, brightness, and positions.","title":"From Reality to Digital Code","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:10:23.735001"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421171022_21509cb0.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421170924_34fb7649.mp3","textContent":"Raw video files would be enormous without special tricks to make them smaller. In a data center filled with servers, Tesla observed how compression algorithms work. These clever mathematical formulas identify patterns and redundancies in videos. Instead of storing every pixel of every frame, compression keeps track of what changes between frames. For example, if a blue sky stays the same for several seconds, the computer only needs to remember \"blue sky continues\" rather than repeatedly storing the same information.","title":"Compression Magic","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:10:23.735001"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421171023_02d0d36f.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421170930_bafb7a0a.mp3","textContent":"Digital video data travels across vast networks before reaching our computers. Visualizing the internet as highways, Tesla traced how data packets move through underwater cables, satellites, and fiber optic lines. These compressed video files split into smaller chunks called packets, each with its own address label. They zoom through the global network at nearly the speed of light, taking different routes to reach their destination. When they arrive, they reassemble in the correct order, like puzzle pieces finding their places.","title":"The Journey Through Networks","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:10:23.735001"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421171023_f18d37e5.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421170936_3fae8a91.mp3","textContent":"Inside the computer, specialized hardware and software work together to rebuild the video. The graphics processing unit (GPU) – a powerful chip designed for handling images – springs into action. Tesla watched in fascination as the compressed data transformed back into frames. The decoder reads the instructions for recreating each frame, unpacking the compressed information and calculating what each pixel should display. This happens so quickly that we perceive smooth motion instead of individual images.","title":"Decoding the Digital Puzzle","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:10:23.735001"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421171023_b6b9d5bc.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E7%94%B5%E8%84%91%E8%83%BD%E6%92%AD%E8%A7%86%E9%A2%91%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421170942_5363fd89.mp3","textContent":"The final step happens when electrical signals tell each pixel on the screen what color to display. Standing before a giant magnified screen, Tesla could see individual pixels lighting up. Modern displays refresh these pixels many times per second – typically 60 times or more. Our brains blend these rapidly changing images together through a phenomenon called persistence of vision. This creates the illusion of continuous movement, allowing us to enjoy movies, video calls, and games on our computers.","title":"From Bits to Visual Magic","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:10:23.735001"}],"imageValid":true}

title: The Brilliant Science of Light Bulbs
topic_question: Why can light bulbs glow and keep our rooms bright?
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962947531885441","knowledgeAreaId":"Physics & Science","characterId":"7","chatGroupCode":"a52ce785-241a-45b0-a95d-65879995a685","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_01_20250421171319_d98c2bdd.png","bookTitle":"The Brilliant Science of Light Bulbs","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_01_20250421171319_d98c2bdd.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_01_20250421171211_11bdb12d.mp3","textContent":"Darkness filled the room as night fell. Tesla stood by the window, flipping a light switch. Instantly, the room brightened! \"Have you ever wondered how these magical glass bulbs work?\" he asked. Inside each bulb was a thin wire called a filament. When electricity flowed through this wire, it heated up so much that it began to glow brightly. This amazing transformation from electricity to light happened in just a fraction of a second.","title":"The Mystery of Glowing Bulbs","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:13:20.163176"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_02_20250421171319_e5aad0da.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_02_20250421171216_87023ca7.mp3","textContent":"Power plants across the countryside generated electricity day and night. Tesla traced the path of electricity with his finger along an illustrated map. The journey began at massive generators where magnets spun rapidly, creating electrical current. This electricity traveled through thick cables, power lines, and finally into homes. Like water flowing through pipes, electricity needed a complete path—a circuit—to flow. Without this unbroken path, bulbs would remain dark.","title":"Electricity's Journey","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:13:20.163176"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_03_20250421171319_b12e77cd.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_03_20250421171223_1f462b6b.mp3","textContent":"Mountains appeared small from the airplane window as Tesla flew over. He sketched the inside of a light bulb on his notepad. The tungsten filament inside was the true hero of illumination. This special metal had high resistance, meaning it fought against electrical flow. This resistance created heat—reaching nearly 4,500 degrees Fahrenheit! At such extreme temperatures, the filament didn't just get hot; it became incandescent, emitting visible light that brightened entire rooms.","title":"The Resistance Hero","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:13:20.163176"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_04_20250421171319_a4c29625.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_04_20250421171229_10b9ec47.mp3","textContent":"Ancient oil lamps lined the shelves of the historical museum. Tesla examined a recreation of Thomas Edison's workshop, where the first practical incandescent bulb was perfected after thousands of experiments. Early bulbs burned out quickly until Edison discovered that carbonized bamboo filaments lasted longer. Modern bulbs evolved from these early designs, using vacuum or inert gases inside the glass to prevent the filament from burning up instantly when it reached those incredible temperatures.","title":"Edison's Workshop","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:13:20.163176"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_05_20250421171319_a6a0ca74.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_05_20250421171234_16f6b80f.mp3","textContent":"Colorful lights illuminated the science exhibition hall. Tesla demonstrated different lighting technologies to visiting students. While traditional bulbs created light through heat, newer technologies worked differently. Fluorescent tubes contained mercury vapor that produced ultraviolet light when electrified, which then caused the phosphor coating inside to glow. LED lights used tiny semiconductor chips that directly converted electricity to light without wasting energy as heat, making them much more efficient.","title":"Beyond Incandescence","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:13:20.163176"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_06_20250421171319_48be4377.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Why+can+light+bulbs+glow+and+keep+our+rooms+bright%3F_06_20250421171240_741299c5.mp3","textContent":"Stars twinkled in the night sky as Tesla set up a solar-powered lamp in his garden. Light bulbs had transformed human civilization, extending productive hours beyond sunset. The newest lighting technologies mimicked natural light patterns to support human health. Smart bulbs could change brightness and color, or turn on automatically when needed. As Tesla adjusted the lamp's settings with his phone, he smiled thinking about how far we'd come from the days of candles and oil lamps.","title":"The Future Glows Bright","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:13:20.163176"}],"imageValid":true}
ser_send: {"age":11,"characterId":"7","chatGroupCode":"a52ce785-241a-45b0-a95d-65879995a685","knowledgeAreaId":"Physics & Science","language":"en","pickedRole":"Tesla","topicQuestion":"Why can light bulbs glow and keep our rooms bright?","userId":"1897962947531885441"}

title: Leo's Roar Among the Stars
topic_question: 你知道狮子座吗？
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962947531885441","knowledgeAreaId":"Astronomy","characterId":"6","chatGroupCode":"30aa086d-1a1c-4200-bc09-ea4cfb1702b2","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421172206_bf6efc77.png","bookTitle":"Leo's Roar Among the Stars","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421172206_bf6efc77.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421172053_fd11598b.mp3","textContent":"Stars twinkled like diamonds across the night sky. Some formed interesting shapes that looked like animals or objects. Galileo stood on a grassy hill, pointing his telescope upward. He was searching for Leo, one of the most famous constellations. Ancient people had connected these star patterns to stories and myths, helping them remember the positions of stars throughout the year. Leo was especially important because it resembled a mighty lion.","title":"The Night Sky's Patterns","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:22:07.861627"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421172206_83ceb431.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421172059_0df3e1d7.mp3","textContent":"In a grand library filled with ancient scrolls, star charts covered the walls. The constellation Leo had been known for thousands of years. Egyptian pyramids aligned with it, and Greek myths told of the Nemean Lion defeated by Hercules. Galileo carefully examined an old star map, tracing the outline of Leo with his finger. The constellation had guided sailors and travelers across seas and deserts long before modern navigation tools existed.","title":"Ancient Star Stories","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:22:07.861627"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421172206_94bcc68a.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421172105_d3896b04.mp3","textContent":"The planetarium dome lit up with twinkling lights. A bright pattern resembling a lion appeared. Leo's main stars formed a backward question mark called the Sickle, representing the lion's mane and chest. Galileo used a laser pointer to outline the constellation's shape. The bright star Regulus marked the lion's heart, while other stars formed its body and tail. Together, these stars created one of the zodiac's most recognizable patterns.","title":"Finding Leo's Shape","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:22:07.861627"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421172207_45db1c38.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421172110_d5ed4991.mp3","textContent":"Massive telescopes pointed toward the heavens at an observatory. Regulus, Leo's brightest star, appeared on the monitor screens. This blue-white giant shone 140 times brighter than our sun! Galileo adjusted the telescope controls, revealing that Regulus wasn't just one star but actually four stars orbiting each other. Located about 79 light-years from Earth, this stellar system contained secrets invisible to the naked eye.","title":"Leo's Special Star","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:22:07.861627"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421172207_1f81a7cb.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421172116_093b5cd6.mp3","textContent":"Colorful zodiac wheels decorated the astronomy classroom walls. Leo held a special position among the twelve zodiac constellations. The sun passed through Leo from mid-August to mid-September each year. Galileo drew the zodiac circle on the blackboard, explaining how ancient astronomers divided the sun's yearly path into twelve sections. Leo's position helped farmers know when to plant crops and marked important seasonal changes.","title":"Leo in the Zodiac","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:22:07.861627"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421172207_ff453a40.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BD%A0%E7%9F%A5%E9%81%93%E7%8B%AE%E5%AD%90%E5%BA%A7%E5%90%97%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421172122_c9cf0d9c.mp3","textContent":"The sunset painted the sky with orange and purple hues. As darkness fell, stars began to appear one by one. Spring and early summer evenings offered the best time to spot Leo high in the sky. Galileo set up his telescope in the backyard, ready for stargazing. He explained that anyone could find Leo by looking for the backward question mark shape and following it to the triangle that formed the lion's hindquarters.","title":"Spotting Leo Tonight","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:22:07.861627"}],"imageValid":true}

title: Saturn's Sparkling Cosmic Necklace
topic_question: How are Saturn's rings made up of ice and rock particles?
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962947531885441","knowledgeAreaId":"Astronomy","characterId":"6","chatGroupCode":"3623ea0b-bdb2-4862-8160-b989592018e5","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_01_20250421172936_e5faf2a4.png","bookTitle":"Saturn's Sparkling Cosmic Necklace","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_01_20250421172936_e5faf2a4.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_01_20250421172824_09793db5.mp3","textContent":"The night sky twinkled with countless stars. Among them, a beautiful planet with magnificent rings caught the eye. Galileo adjusted his powerful telescope, focusing on Saturn's distinctive rings. He sketched the breathtaking sight in his notebook, wondering what these mysterious rings were made of. Unlike other planets, Saturn wore these spectacular bands like cosmic jewelry, stretching thousands of miles into space.","title":"The Ringed Wonder","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:29:38.187058"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_02_20250421172937_378f0ea1.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_02_20250421172830_6aa6b6b0.mp3","textContent":"Billions of years ago, a massive moon orbited too close to Saturn. The powerful gravitational forces tore this moon apart. Galileo created a model using ice and rocks to demonstrate this event. He placed a large ball representing Saturn and smaller objects around it. The smaller objects, pulled by gravity, shattered into countless pieces. This catastrophic event scattered debris all around Saturn's equator.","title":"Ancient Cosmic Collision","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:29:38.187058"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_03_20250421172937_394303db.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_03_20250421172835_128af7d0.mp3","textContent":"The vast majority of Saturn's rings consist of water ice particles. In his laboratory, Galileo examined ice crystals under a microscope. They ranged from tiny specks smaller than sand to chunks as big as houses. He sprinkled some ice particles onto a black surface, showing how they reflected light brilliantly. Similarly, in space, these ice particles reflect sunlight, making Saturn's rings shine brightly against the darkness.","title":"Ice Particles Dance","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:29:38.187058"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_04_20250421172937_257ccca6.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_04_20250421172841_f50c6f60.mp3","textContent":"The mountain path wound through a rocky landscape. Galileo collected different rock samples, explaining how Saturn's rings also contain rocky material. He placed these rocks alongside the ice in his model. While less common than ice, these rock fragments add to the rings' structure. Some originated from asteroids or comets that ventured too close to Saturn's powerful gravitational pull and were broken apart.","title":"Rock Fragments Join","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:29:38.187058"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_05_20250421172937_1bedd132.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_05_20250421172847_2a047227.mp3","textContent":"The playground carousel spun around, demonstrating centrifugal force. Galileo explained how Saturn's particles orbit at different speeds. He set up a series of concentric rings on the ground, showing how inner particles travel faster than outer ones. This creates the distinct gaps between rings. The largest gap, called the Cassini Division, formed because of gravitational resonance with one of Saturn's moons, pushing particles away from that region.","title":"Orbital Dance","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:29:38.187058"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_06_20250421172937_3d67a8d5.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_How+are+Saturn%27s+rings+made+up+of+ice+and+rock+particles%3F_06_20250421172853_c065fef1.mp3","textContent":"The sunset painted the sky in beautiful colors. Galileo pointed out that Saturn's rings are relatively young and temporary. Using an hourglass, he demonstrated how the rings are slowly raining material onto Saturn. In about 100 million years, they might disappear completely. Some particles escape into space, while others spiral inward toward the planet. This constant movement makes Saturn's rings a dynamic, ever-changing cosmic spectacle.","title":"Rings Through Time","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T17:29:38.187058"}],"imageValid":true}
ser_send: {"age":11,"characterId":"6","chatGroupCode":"3623ea0b-bdb2-4862-8160-b989592018e5","knowledgeAreaId":"Astronomy","language":"en","pickedRole":"Galileo","topicQuestion":"How are Saturn's rings made up of ice and rock particles?","userId":"1897962947531885441"}

title: Saturn: The Impossible Gas Home
topic_question: Can humans live on Saturn?
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962947531885441","knowledgeAreaId":"Astronomy","characterId":"6","chatGroupCode":"db48265a-7836-46ee-a165-cd403e7dfaeb","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_01_20250421181047_3513a4b7.png","bookTitle":"Saturn: The Impossible Gas Home","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_01_20250421181047_3513a4b7.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_01_20250421180931_92ae6a9a.mp3","textContent":"The ringed planet Saturn shimmered like a jewel in the night sky. Galileo peered through his powerful telescope, marveling at the beautiful bands of color swirling across its surface. Unlike Earth's solid ground, Saturn is made almost entirely of gas—mostly hydrogen and helium. The planet has no surface to stand on! It's like trying to walk on clouds, except these clouds are thousands of miles deep.","title":"Saturn's Gaseous Giant","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:10:49.034839"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_02_20250421181048_517a988f.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_02_20250421180937_0d4fd13f.mp3","textContent":"Snowflakes drifted down around Galileo's research station in Antarctica. Even in this frigid environment, he felt positively toasty compared to Saturn. The temperature on Saturn plunges to minus 288 degrees Fahrenheit! Galileo checked his special thermometer and shivered. At such extreme cold, water would freeze instantly, and humans would need far more than winter coats to survive—our bodies simply couldn't function in such conditions.","title":"Extreme Temperatures","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:10:49.034839"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_03_20250421181048_fb88a6ba.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_03_20250421180943_f0da9fc1.mp3","textContent":"Deep beneath the ocean's surface, a submarine descended. Inside, Galileo observed the pressure gauge climbing higher. Earth's deepest oceans reach impressive pressures, but Saturn's atmosphere is another story entirely. As you travel toward Saturn's core, the pressure becomes millions of times stronger than Earth's atmosphere. Galileo calculated that any spacecraft—or human—would be crushed long before reaching what scientists call Saturn's \"surface.\"","title":"Crushing Pressure","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:10:49.034839"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_04_20250421181048_185961ed.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_04_20250421180949_3407b72b.mp3","textContent":"The chemistry lab buzzed with activity as colorful gases filled special containers. Galileo carefully analyzed Saturn's atmospheric composition through his spectrometer. Unlike Earth's oxygen-rich air that humans need to breathe, Saturn's atmosphere contains toxic gases like ammonia and phosphine. Galileo noted that without special equipment, humans couldn't take even a single breath there—our lungs require oxygen, which is virtually absent on the giant planet.","title":"Deadly Atmosphere","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:10:49.034839"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_05_20250421181048_0a94098d.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_05_20250421180956_c739ec87.mp3","textContent":"Astronauts floated gracefully in the space station above Earth. Galileo watched their movements while considering Saturn's powerful gravitational pull. Though Saturn is less dense than water (it would float in a giant bathtub!), its enormous size creates gravity about 107% stronger than Earth's. Galileo calculated that our muscles and bones, evolved for Earth's conditions, would struggle under this extra force, making even simple movements difficult and tiring.","title":"Gravity Problems","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:10:49.034839"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_06_20250421181048_8192b954.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+humans+live+on+Saturn%3F_06_20250421181001_ee76bdfb.mp3","textContent":"The advanced space habitat gleamed in the sunlight, rotating slowly to create artificial gravity. Galileo designed special floating stations that might someday orbit Saturn's moons rather than the planet itself. Titan, Saturn's largest moon, has a thick atmosphere and liquid lakes—though of methane, not water. Galileo sketched plans for protected habitats where humans might visit these worlds someday, not to live on Saturn itself, but to explore its fascinating system from a safe distance.","title":"Future Possibilities","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:10:49.034839"}],"imageValid":true}
ser_send: {"age":11,"characterId":"6","chatGroupCode":"db48265a-7836-46ee-a165-cd403e7dfaeb","knowledgeAreaId":"Astronomy","language":"en","pickedRole":"Galileo","topicQuestion":"Can humans live on Saturn?","userId":"1897962947531885441"}

title: 蓝色大水盆
topic_question: 为什么太平洋被称为世界上最大和最深的海洋？
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962948542976000","knowledgeAreaId":"Geography","characterId":"1","chatGroupCode":"2df7003c-7f92-45c7-895c-577099ebb03b","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421183000_5db54a9d.png","bookTitle":"蓝色大水盆","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421183000_5db54a9d.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421182851_a9d963d8.mp3","textContent":"蓝色的海洋覆盖着地球大部分表面。Magellan站在世界地图前，指着最大的蓝色区域。他的眼睛闪闪发亮，手指轻轻划过那片辽阔的蓝色。\"哇！这就是太平洋！\"Magellan惊叹道，\"它比所有陆地加起来还要大呢！\"","title":"蓝色大海洋","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:30:01.951460"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421183000_b454480a.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421182857_06aec6d8.mp3","textContent":"太平洋像一个超级大水盆。Magellan拿出一个透明球模型，里面有蓝色的水和小小的陆地。他转动球体，指着最大的水域笑着说：\"太平洋占据了地球表面的三分之一哦！从北到南，从东到西，都是它的地盘，咕噜咕噜~\"","title":"巨大的水盆","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:30:01.951460"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421183001_65f641d0.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421182902_96384ec3.mp3","textContent":"海底有许多神秘的峡谷。Magellan潜入水中，游到一个深深的海沟边缘。\"噗通噗通\"，他的心跳加速。\"这是马里亚纳海沟，比最高的山还要深！\"Magellan伸出手比划着，\"如果把珠穆朗玛峰放进去，山顶上面还有好多好多水呢！\"","title":"深深的海沟","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:30:01.951460"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421183001_8891779a.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421182907_12937dcc.mp3","textContent":"太平洋周围有许多火山。Magellan站在海边的一座小山上，看着远处冒烟的火山。\"轰隆隆！\"远处传来低沉的声音。\"这些火山围成一个大圈圈，就像太平洋的项链！\"Magellan画了一个圆圈，脸上露出惊奇的表情。","title":"环太平洋火山带","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:30:01.951460"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421183001_a38cd306.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421182913_d59f86fd.mp3","textContent":"很久以前，勇敢的探险家们航行在这片海洋上。Magellan站在一艘木船上，风吹动他的头发。\"呼呼~\"海风唱着歌。\"第一个环球航行的人也叫Magellan哦！他发现太平洋风平浪静，所以给它起名叫'太平洋'！\"Magellan自豪地挺起胸膛。","title":"航海大发现","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:30:01.951460"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421183001_7712ceed.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E5%A4%AA%E5%B9%B3%E6%B4%8B%E8%A2%AB%E7%A7%B0%E4%B8%BA%E4%B8%96%E7%95%8C%E4%B8%8A%E6%9C%80%E5%A4%A7%E5%92%8C%E6%9C%80%E6%B7%B1%E7%9A%84%E6%B5%B7%E6%B4%8B%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421182919_50b25374.mp3","textContent":"太平洋里住着无数的海洋生物。Magellan戴上潜水镜，看见五颜六色的鱼儿游来游去。\"哗啦哗啦\"，水波荡漾。\"太平洋不仅最大最深，还是最多生物的家园呢！\"Magellan伸手轻轻碰触一条小丑鱼，开心地笑了。","title":"海洋大宝藏","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T18:30:01.951460"}],"imageValid":true}
ser_send: {"age":5,"characterId":"1","chatGroupCode":"2df7003c-7f92-45c7-895c-577099ebb03b","knowledgeAreaId":"Geography","language":"cn","pickedRole":"Magellan","topicQuestion":"为什么太平洋被称为世界上最大和最深的海洋？","userId":"1897962948542976000"}

title: 动物冬眠大揭秘
topic_question: 为什么有些动物会在冬天冬眠？
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962948542976000","knowledgeAreaId":"Biology & Nature","characterId":"5","chatGroupCode":"6cf71168-badc-4be0-9597-14b50428a42c","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421191036_1b7c69d9.png","bookTitle":"动物冬眠大揭秘","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421191036_1b7c69d9.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421190928_1c37abee.mp3","textContent":"森林里的雪花纷纷飘落。Darwin穿着厚厚的大衣，踩在松软的雪地上。他看到树叶都掉光了，小溪结了冰。冬天来了，食物变少了，天气好冷呀！Darwin搓搓手，呼出的气变成了白雾。他想知道动物们都去哪儿了？","title":"冬天的森林","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:10:37.750290"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421191036_e314a2c9.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421190934_024ca076.mp3","textContent":"一个雪covered的山洞前，Darwin轻轻走近。洞里，一只棕熊正在呼呼大睡。Darwin悄悄观察：熊在秋天吃了很多食物，身体储存了厚厚的脂肪。现在它的心跳变慢了，呼吸也慢慢的。Darwin明白了，这就是冬眠！熊靠着储存的脂肪，能睡一整个冬天。","title":"熊的洞穴","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:10:37.750290"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421191036_ebe5d013.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421190939_38e657c3.mp3","textContent":"雪地旁，Darwin拿出一个温度计。\"哇！外面只有零下5度！\"他看着数字惊叹。冬眠的动物们身体温度会降低很多，就像省电模式。Darwin画了个图表：正常时熊的体温37度，冬眠时只有30度左右。这样动物们就能省下很多能量，不用一直找食物啦！","title":"温度实验","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:10:37.750290"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421191037_a6c49138.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421190944_dabdb916.mp3","textContent":"阳光照在雪地上，闪闪发光。Darwin发现一棵大树下有个小洞。他轻轻挖开，哇！里面有许多坚果和种子。Darwin笑了：\"这是松鼠的储藏室！\"有些小动物不冬眠，它们在秋天收集食物，藏起来过冬。Darwin小心地把洞口盖好，不能偷走松鼠的宝贝！","title":"食物储备","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:10:37.750290"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421191037_f7250713.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421190949_3f9d43af.mp3","textContent":"结冰的池塘边，Darwin蹲下来。\"青蛙去哪儿了呢？\"他轻轻敲敲冰面。原来，青蛙躲在池底的泥土里！它们的心跳几乎停止，身体里有特殊物质，像防冻液一样。Darwin画了张青蛙冬眠图：\"它们不是睡觉，而是身体暂停了，等春天再醒来！\"","title":"青蛙池塘","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:10:37.750290"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421191037_54c8021c.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%B8%BA%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%9C%89%E4%BA%9B%E5%8A%A8%E7%89%A9%E4%BC%9A%E5%9C%A8%E5%86%AC%E5%A4%A9%E5%86%AC%E7%9C%A0%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421190955_d5006c1a.mp3","textContent":"几个月后，小花从雪地里钻出来。Darwin感觉阳光变暖了。\"春天要来啦！\"他兴奋地跳起来。动物们感觉到了温度变化，慢慢醒来。Darwin看到熊从洞里出来伸懒腰，青蛙开始呱呱叫。冬眠结束了！Darwin明白了：冬眠是动物们聪明的生存方式！","title":"春天的信号","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:10:37.750290"}],"imageValid":true}
ser_send: {"age":5,"characterId":"5","chatGroupCode":"6cf71168-badc-4be0-9597-14b50428a42c","knowledgeAreaId":"Biology & Nature","language":"cn","pickedRole":"Darwin","topicQuestion":"为什么有些动物会在冬天冬眠？","userId":"1897962948542976000"}

title: 闪亮小精灵
topic_question: 什么是星星？
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962948542976000","knowledgeAreaId":"Astronomy","characterId":"6","chatGroupCode":"74747252-d344-4950-b034-0e6a54892d86","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421191718_359e6143.png","bookTitle":"闪亮小精灵","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421191718_359e6143.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421191611_b749a14e.mp3","textContent":"夜晚来临，天空变成深蓝色。小小的亮点开始出现在天空中。Galileo拿出他的望远镜，仰望星空。他看到了好多闪闪发光的星星，像小灯笼一样挂在天上。星星眨呀眨，好像在和他打招呼！","title":"夜空中的亮点","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:17:19.982243"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421191718_20a9a61e.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421191617_dae777f4.mp3","textContent":"星星其实是超级大的气球！它们比地球大很多很多。夜空中看起来小小的，是因为离我们太远啦。Galileo用手比划着，告诉我们如果把星星放在手心，它会比整个城市还大！星星就像天空中的巨人，只是站得太远才看起来小小的。","title":"巨大的气球","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:17:19.982243"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421191719_17118a89.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421191622_20b06005.mp3","textContent":"星星为什么会亮呢？它们是大大的火球！里面热热的，像火炉一样。Galileo感受着太阳的温暖，解释说太阳也是一颗星星，只是离我们最近的一颗。星星里面的气体不停碰撞，产生光和热，咻咻地往外冒，所以我们能看到它们发光。","title":"发光的火球","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:17:19.982243"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421191719_67872bd8.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421191628_5e46cda3.mp3","textContent":"星星有不同的颜色哦！有红色、蓝色、黄色。Galileo拿出彩色的玻璃片，透过它们看星星。他告诉我们，星星的颜色告诉我们它有多热。蓝色的星星最热，红色的星星凉一些。就像火焰中心是蓝色的，外面是红色的一样！","title":"彩色的光芒","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:17:19.982243"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421191719_45ca16d3.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421191633_739ac12f.mp3","textContent":"星星住在星系里，像一个大家族。我们的太阳和地球住在银河系。Galileo画了一个旋转的圆盘，上面撒满亮晶晶的小点。他指着其中一个小点说，那是我们的太阳，周围还有好多好多星星，多得数不完！银河系像一个大大的飞碟，转啊转。","title":"星星的家族","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:17:19.982243"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421191719_3b31a0a4.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421191639_829dca53.mp3","textContent":"星星也有生命呢！它们会出生、长大和变老。Galileo吹起一个小泡泡，看着它慢慢飘走。他说小星星从宇宙中的气体云里诞生，慢慢长大变亮。老星星会变得很大很红，最后会像泡泡一样\"砰\"地一下，把亮亮的东西撒向宇宙！","title":"星星的生命","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:17:19.982243"}],"imageValid":true}
ser_send: {"age":5,"characterId":"6","chatGroupCode":"74747252-d344-4950-b034-0e6a54892d86","knowledgeAreaId":"Astronomy","language":"cn","pickedRole":"Galileo","topicQuestion":"什么是星星？","userId":"1897962948542976000"}

title: 天空中的火球
topic_question: 什么是星星？
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962948542976000","knowledgeAreaId":"Astronomy","characterId":"6","chatGroupCode":"1a2b1cba-f0f4-4206-bc1d-cd381cef722f","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421192331_bebd8e7b.png","bookTitle":"天空中的火球","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421192331_bebd8e7b.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_01_20250421192218_8c61ba03.mp3","textContent":"夜空中有许多亮点。Galileo站在草地上，仰头望着深蓝色的天空。他眨眨眼睛，看到星星一闪一闪。有的星星亮亮的，有的暗暗的。Galileo伸出小手，好像要摸一摸那些小星星。\"哇！好多小灯笼！\"","title":"闪烁的天空","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:23:32.663818"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421192331_499fc22a.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_02_20250421192223_4f9fd831.mp3","textContent":"星星其实是超级大的火球。Galileo在天文台里，透过望远镜观察。他看到星星不是小点点，而是巨大的气体球。它们像太阳一样，自己会发光发热。Galileo的脸被望远镜反射的光照得亮亮的，眼睛里闪烁着好奇。","title":"巨大的火球","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:23:32.663818"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421192331_3acf2f6d.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_03_20250421192229_66e859e1.mp3","textContent":"星星离我们非常非常远。Galileo在沙滩上画了一条长长的线。\"这条线有一百万个我那么长！\"他指着线的尽头说。星星比这还要远很多很多倍呢！Galileo抬头看天，感觉星星的光走了好久好久才到他眼睛里。","title":"遥远的距离","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:23:32.663818"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421192332_8c86742a.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_04_20250421192234_74e6755a.mp3","textContent":"星星有不同的颜色哦。Galileo拿出彩色蜡笔，画下他看到的星星。有红红的，蓝蓝的，还有黄黄的。不同颜色的星星温度不一样。蓝色的星星最热，红色的星星最凉。Galileo用手指点着画上的星星，开心地数着颜色。","title":"星星的颜色","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:23:32.663818"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421192332_589a5650.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_05_20250421192239_618b46aa.mp3","textContent":"星星也有生命周期。Galileo在沙堆前蹲下来，堆了一个小沙堆。\"星星刚出生时很小。\"然后他把沙堆堆得更大，\"长大后变得很亮。\"最后他轻轻推倒沙堆，\"很老很老后，星星会慢慢熄灭。\"Galileo的眼睛闪着思考的光。","title":"星星的生命","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:23:32.663818"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421192332_b01acbdd.png","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_%E4%BB%80%E4%B9%88%E6%98%AF%E6%98%9F%E6%98%9F%EF%BC%9F_06_20250421192245_0c6fadb5.mp3","textContent":"夜空中有时会有流星划过。Galileo躺在毯子上，突然指着天空：\"看！流星！\"一道亮光快速划过天空。这不是真的星星，而是小石头掉进地球大气层，烧得发光啦。Galileo闭上眼睛，双手合十，对着流星许了个愿。","title":"许愿星星","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-21T19:23:32.663818"}],"imageValid":true}
