title: Diving Deep: The Magic of Submarines
topic_question: Can you tell me something about submarine?
dialogue: {"userId":"1897962947531885441","knowledgeAreaId":"Physics & Science","characterId":"7","chatGroupCode":"fdd9eb13-0fd5-4fe6-a830-62b2da1d00cf","coverUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_01_20250427133338_07500bcb.webp","bookTitle":"Diving Deep: The Magic of Submarines","pageCount":"6","pages":[{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_01_20250427133338_07500bcb.webp","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_01_20250427133031_934abef9.mp3","textContent":"Deep in the blue ocean, special boats called submarines swim underwater. Tesla watches from the beach as a submarine dives beneath the waves. Splash! The submarine can go deep, deep down. It has a strong metal shell that keeps water out. Submarines are like fish-shaped boats that can breathe underwater. They move up and down and all around in the deep blue sea. 🌊","title":"Underwater Boats","pageNumber":0,"createdAt":"2025-04-27T13:33:38.823545"},{"imageUrl":null,"audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_02_20250427133037_6ebaa431.mp3","textContent":"Water fills special tanks inside the submarine to make it sink. Tesla points to a model showing how this works. Glug, glug, glug! When the tanks fill with water, the submarine gets heavier. Down, down it goes! To come back up, the submarine pushes water out with big air bubbles. Whoosh! The submarine becomes lighter and floats up like a balloon. Up, up it rises to the surface! 🛥️","title":"How Submarines Dive","pageNumber":1,"createdAt":"2025-04-27T13:33:38.823545"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_03_20250427133338_1f3d91d8.webp","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_03_20250427133043_fc01de76.mp3","textContent":"Inside a submarine, people can live for many days. Tesla explores a submarine museum with tiny beds and a little kitchen. People eat, sleep, and work inside this underwater home. The air inside is clean and fresh from special machines. Lights glow and buttons blink on control panels. There are tiny windows called portholes to peek at fish swimming by. It's cozy but small! 🛌","title":"Living Inside Submarines","pageNumber":2,"createdAt":"2025-04-27T13:33:38.823545"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_04_20250427133338_aa64a1a8.webp","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_04_20250427133048_968e7b81.mp3","textContent":"Submarines need special tools to see in dark water. Tesla looks through a periscope that works like a tall mirror. It helps see above water while staying hidden below. Beep, beep, beep! Sonar makes sounds that bounce off things underwater. The sounds come back like echoes. This helps find fish, rocks, and other submarines. Without these tools, the submarine would be blind in the deep blue sea. 👁️","title":"Submarine Eyes and Ears","pageNumber":3,"createdAt":"2025-04-27T13:33:38.823545"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_05_20250427133338_da5c44db.webp","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_05_20250427133054_fffbef2b.mp3","textContent":"Some submarines explore the deepest ocean parts. Tesla watches videos of deep-sea submarines finding strange glowing fish. Scientists use them to study underwater volcanoes and shipwrecks. Other submarines carry sailors who protect their countries. Some even rescue people from sinking ships! The biggest submarines are as long as two school buses! They can stay underwater for months and months. 🔍","title":"Submarine Jobs","pageNumber":4,"createdAt":"2025-04-27T13:33:38.823545"},{"imageUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/image_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_06_20250427133338_c702bac1.webp","audioUrl":"https://curio-app-dev-sg.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/upload/audio_Can+you+tell+me+something+about+submarine%3F_06_20250427133059_3eea2328.mp3","textContent":"The ocean has many secrets waiting to be found. Tesla draws pictures of colorful coral reefs that submarines visit. In the deepest parts, it's dark and cold with strange creatures. Submarines help us learn about these hidden places. They take pictures and collect tiny animals for study. Without submarines, we wouldn't know about the amazing underwater mountains, valleys, and creatures in our oceans. 🐙","title":"Submarine Adventures","pageNumber":5,"createdAt":"2025-04-27T13:33:38.823545"}],"imageValid":true}
